text: my child be was an expatriate he was an
operator he was a brilliant man who had
a scientific background and somebody who
had character flaws it really undermine
just about everything else he wanted to
do with Iraq I will be very much part of
the future of Allah but I'm not a
candidate for any political office one
day he called me up and said I'm driving
up to Kirkuk do you want to come and I
said sure so I jumped in the car we
looked at the pipeline's that were being
constantly bombed and we stopped at
various places people would kisses his
fingers as if he were the Pope he'd
promised them favors which is the way
politics gets done in Iraq and they
would thank him essentially on bended
knee he was never in doubt about his own
abilities to fix the country told me a
long story about his grandfather's uncle
and a debt that hadn't been paid and
after he told this rambling anecdote he
looked at me he said one thing you
should know about it Rockies we never
forget and I think that it was settling
scores really family Skouras political
scores personal scores that were at the
top of the list of what he wanted to
achieve in Iraq that made him a
politician that made him an activist
that drove up McCurry gave him great
energy but first and foremost strip away
all the sophistication and all the
history yeah he was an Iraqi with a
grudge and he was never going to be
anything else and he really didn't
pretend to be any anything else
